phrases: Let us skip training today.
You were hurt pretty badly.
No, my injuries pose no problem.
I am more concerned about you, Shirou.
Are you all right?
Yeah, I am okay.
If you are in pain, do not hesitate to speak up.
Sure.
That is a relief...
The pain is gone.
Yesterday was pretty rough, I guess.
I think I will make breakfast as thanks.
Shirou?
Kuzuki-sensei has called in sick today.
Seriously?
Kuzuki-sensei did?
Is not it supposed to snow today?
Sweet!
Study hall!
Settle down, everyone...
I know that normally, this is your World History class,
but since I am here, let us have an English pop quiz!
No quizzes!
Tyrant!
Taiga!
Shut up!
If I make last period on Saturday study hall, it will just turn into playtime!
So graciously accept your teacher's kindness!
School has now ended.
Students are not permitted to remain on campus after school hours.
Please leave immediately.
Should I be worried?
My arm's numb, but somehow, it feels heavier.
I forgot to talk to Tohsaka.
Well, if she did not come to me, I doubt there were any major developments.
Sorry I am home late.
I will have lunch ready in a minute.
Shirou?
That is the first time I have ever broken a dish.
Sorry.
I will clean it up right away.
Do not worry about it.
Just sit at the table.
You must be fatigued, Shirou.
It is all right.
I will clean it up.
Maybe I am tired...
Thanks.
Coming!
T-Tohsaka?
What are you doing here?
I am here because you stood me up at our regular check-in.
Stood you up?
Okay, I admit that I forgot to meet you...
But did we agree on regular check-ins?
Sorry!
I apologize for forgetting.
As your partner, I should check in with you regularly.
Let us use this opportunity to hold our meeting here today.
Hang on, we were just about to have lunch!
That is perfect.
I have not had lunch yet,
so I will join you.
Hey, not so fast!
So in the end, our only option against Caster is to resort to using force.
I believe so.
There is a powerful barrier against spiritual beings erected around that mountain.
The front gate is the only way in.
So if we force our way onto the temple grounds, Caster will be waiting.
I suppose...
Wait, why are you sitting so far away?
Because you poached my usual place!
Anyway, once we are on the grounds, the question is how we will corner Caster.
If we play our cards wrong, she might take out all of Ryuudou Temple.
True, that is something Caster could do.
Saber, do not say scary stuff like that so casually!
Are you saying that Caster will self-destruct if we corner her?
It is likely, yes.
I believe she would.
You two are totally in sync...
Wow, it is this late already?
I guess we should wrap things up.
I need to get dinner started.
What is it, Emiya-kun?
Why are you staring at me?
No, I was just...
Oh, I get it...
In public, we are fellow Masters, so I do not bother you there,
but inside your own home,
you revert to your natural instincts.
I am a guy, so it is a perfectly ordinary reaction.
But it is odd, is not it?
Saber is a girl.
And from what I hear, Fujimura-sensei and Sakura are always coming over.
I should not be any different.
Look, just go home, okay?
Oh?
How can I go home, when we have yet to settle on a strategy?
Shirou, Rin's point is valid, is it not?
I see no issue with her staying here.
Do not you start, too...
All right, fine.
But Fuji-nee...
Fujimura-sensei will probably show up later,
so you will have to persuade her yourself.
I know, I know.
I know all about Fujimura-sensei, so do not worry about that.
Do not blame me if this blows up in your face.
I am home!
Boy, it is cold!
I think it is going to snow!
Ah, you are making a hot pot!
That is my Shirou!
You are freezing!
I bet you are awake now!
Be careful!
I am working over a fire here!
Whatever...
Hurry, hurry, hurry!
Hot pot!
Hot pot!
Hot pot!
Come on, get off me!
I hope you do not mind my joining you, Fujimura-sensei.
Why, it is Tohsaka-san!
It is unusual to run into you at Shirou's place...
Hang on.
What are you doing at Shirou's place?!
Hang on, Tohsaka-san!
What are you doing here at this hour?
This is thoughtless of you!
What am I doing here?
I am being treated to dinner at Emiya-kun's place.
I think it is far more thoughtless
of you to barge in without even ringing the doorbell, do not you?
I-I am the household chaperone!
I was left in charge by Emiya-kun's father,
so we are practically family!
Oh, I see.
After dinner, Emiya-kun and I will be studying for a test,
so do not mind us.
Ouch...
Shirou?
I mean, Emiya-kun!
What is the meaning of this?
If it is difficult to address him formally, do not push yourself to do so.
What you call Emiya-kun is none of my concern.
Tohsaka-san, did you hear about this from Sakura-chan?
Who knows?
Unfortunately, anything that Matou-san told me must be treated as confidential.
But I hope it is exactly as you think.
Game, set, and match.
I will leave these here.
Oh, thanks.
Shall I do the dishes?
It will not be fair if I do nothing in return for dinner.
No, just owe me one.
Fujimura-sensei, is Emiya-kun always this clumsy?
No way.
As long as I have known him, he is never broken a dish.
I bet he is self-conscious because you are here...
As a foreign invader, naturally.
Emiya-kun...
I will take it from here, so go get some rest.
No, I am fine.
I have got this, so go drink some tea.
Are you sure you should not help?
You asked her over, and if you leave her alone, she is going to hate you.
Wh-Why are you reading too far into this, you idiot?
I did not invite her over!
And anyway, I do not really care if Tohsaka hates me.
Huh?
Where is Tohsaka?
I believe she went out into the courtyard.
The courtyard?
Tohsaka?
I like your Bounded Field.
Unlike the one at my house, you can sense human emotion in this one.
Care to join me?
What?
I was just curious.
This house is unique.
It occurred to me that maybe you are better off the way you are.
A hopeless amateur, you mean?
I did not mean it that way, but maybe that is exactly it.
I do not know what Emiya Kiritsugu was like as a mage,
but this compound is incredibly natural.
For a mage's workshop, it is quite open.
It is not like that at your house?
No, it is not.
It tries to keep people out, but once you are in, it does not let you leave.
At times, I think it is wrong, but it is not something I can change.
Personally, I like it the way it is.
I was probably chosen as the heir because my personality is this way.
Was it hard for you?
Training to be a mage?
Sorry to say, but I never found it hard.
Plus, learning new things was fun.
Did not I just tell you?
That is how I am wired.
So if you are worried about me, it is misplaced.
Okay.
Then why are you at school?
If you are going to live a mage's life, is not it sort of pointless?
It may be a detour, but it is not pointless.
It is fun to be a student.
And at heart, I am a hedonist.
Succeeding my father is my duty,
but I would not do it if I did not enjoy it.
Even the reason for my partnership with you is because you are interesting.
I see.
Well, I am glad you are having fun.
Thanks.
And?
It is been fun for you, too, right?
Why are not you saying anything?
Well, I just...
Give me a straight answer, Emiya-kun.
Because I might have completely misunderstood you.
I guess I never thought of mage training as fun.
Even magic itself.
But if the people around me were happy, I was happy.
So if I studied magic, I might be able to help someone someday...
I wanted to be a hero of justice, just like Kiritsugu.
That is why I studied magic.
Anyway, that is my reason.
So then, you did not study magic for yourself?
Did not I, though?
Because it makes me happy to be useful to others.
Look, that is just being happy, not having fun!
Listen, what I am asking is if you personally enjoy it.
I do not care about others,
I am asking if there is anything about magic that you consider fun!
It is hard to say if I personally enjoy it...
I sort of feel like I do not deserve more wishes...
Hey!
Give me a straight answer!
Well...
I guess I do not.
Oh, I am so angry!
So basically,
you are always worrying about others, but never focusing on yourself!
Whoa, hey
Shut up!
No backtalk!
I always thought you were similar, but I never imagined you were this alike!
Calm down, Tohsaka...
Why are you so angry?
I am angry because you do not get why I am angry!
All right.
That settles it.
Tomorrow, I will make you admit defeat!
You are going to go back to chasing me around?
I am!
I will give you a taste of something special I have been saving!
Hey, Tohsaka!
You are going home, right?
I will walk you.
Tohsaka!
Enough with the Tohsaka, Tohsaka!
Tohsaka, what are you wearing?
I spoke to Archer and had him bring me an overnight bag.
I got Fujimura-sensei's permission, so it is fine.
I will use the guest room on the right.
Trace on.
Tracing fundamental structure.
Strengthening component materials.
More magic training tonight?
Yeah, Kiritsugu taught me to never miss a day.
But I guess that was the only thing I really learned from him.
Only that?
He taught you nothing of the wisdom or behavior expected of mages?
No...
After all,
the guy who was supposed to teach me was not really like a mage himself.
He was a poor excuse for an adult.
He would say that if you are going to enjoy something, enjoy it to the fullest,
and then he would play around like a kid.
I understand.
You enjoyed having such a master, did not you?
Yeah, I looked up to him.
He was carefree and nothing like a mage,
but to me, Kiritsugu was a true magic-user.
Shirou...
What is wrong with your left side?
You noticed, Saber?
Yes.
It is just a little numb.
It is not slowing me down at all.
Then the because is...
Yeah, I think it is a reaction to the projection magic I did last night.
Is most of your body still numb?
Archer...
That is hardly surprising.
What do you want, Archer?
I thought we had a non-aggression pact.
Stop right there.
If you come any closer, you must be prepared for the consequences.
Wait, Saber.
He does not want to fight.
But he...
It is okay.
What do you want, Archer?
Knowing you, you did not drop by to say hello.
Rin told me that you performed a projection, and it really is true.
You have no sensation in half your body, and your center of gravity is 7 cm off, right?
I might be of some assistance.
You are fortunate.
I expected to see necrosis,
but something that was closed has been opened.
Something that was closed has been opened?
Circuits you were meant to use from the beginning had grown dormant from neglect.
The numbness is only temporary.
By suddenly flooding circuits you never used with mana at full power,
you sent them into a state of shock.
This means that the circuits have returned to an active state.
That should do it.
You will recover in a few days.
When you can move properly again,
you should be a better mage than before.
You certainly know a lot about this, Archer.
I went through something similar.
At first, I lost the use of one arm.
Wait.
What?
I want to ask you something.
Let your ideals drag you to your death.
What did you mean by that?
It seems self-explanatory.
There is nothing to add.
Then what the hell are you fighting for?
That is obvious.
My reason for fighting is simply for myself.
Just for yourself?
That is right.
If your desire is to fulfill the ideal of not hurting anyone,
then do as you wish.
But only if that desire is truly yours.
If you fight of your own free will,
any resulting crime or punishment is of your own making.
Accepting them is a part of that ideal.
But if that desire was borrowed from another,
the ideals you uphold are mere fantasies.
There must be a reason for fighting.
But that reason must never be an ideal.
If you fight for an ideal, you can only save ideals.
That does not entail helping others.
A reason to fight is the desire to save something.
At the very least, it is for you.
Right, Emiya Shirou?
But salvation by the hands of another is not salvation.
Such salvation is like money.
When used, it passes into another's hands.
It is true that you can probably achieve your wish to save others.
But there is no hope of saving yourself in doing so.
You will repeat the cycle until you die, still clinging to ideals that are not your own.
That is why your ideals are meaningless.
Nothing comes of helping others.
In the end, you can save neither others nor yourself.
A lie of a life.
You are wrong...
That is not true.
You do not have to go to such extremes to help others!
You truly are a foolish child!
You still have no stomach for brutality, do you?
I promised myself that I would fight to stop people like you!
Next Time The Final Decision
Run, Shirou!
